title: Digital Color Formats
description: Learn different formats for representing colors in digital design

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: In digital design, colors can be represented in various formats. Each format has its advantages and is used in different contexts.

hex.title: HEX Color Codes
hex.content: HEX (hexadecimal) format is widely used in web design. It consists of a # symbol and six hexadecimal digits (0-9, A-F) representing red, green, and blue channels. The format is compact and easy to read.

rgb.title: RGB and RGBA
rgb.content: RGB format uses three values from 0 to 255 for red, green, and blue channels. RGBA adds an alpha channel (transparency) from 0 to 1. This format is intuitive and often used in graphics editors.

hsl.title: HSL and HSLA
hsl.content: HSL format describes color through hue, saturation, and lightness. HSLA adds an alpha channel. This format is convenient for programmatically changing color properties, such as darkening or lightening.

css.title: CSS Color Keywords
css.content: CSS provides a set of predefined color keywords such as 'red', 'blue', 'green', and others. These keywords are convenient for quick use but are limited in the number of available colors.
